stories.text:
As of 2022, are there any de-facto standards of data delivery methods (services, protocols, providers) between different companies? Think, Kafka but between different orgs.

Let's assume that the question is about general-case transactional data delivery, so it can't be satisfied by S3 or leading warehouse SaaS (say the receiving side doesn't use those).
stories.title: Ask HN: Intercompany Data Delivery. How?
China builds artificial moon to simulate low gravity
You can't move tabs in Linux Chrome

stories.text: Cold fusion and quantum computing have long seemed just on the cusp of realization, and have been promised as game changers, but practical application always seems to be at least ten years out. What are some examples of other important technologies that seemed to be similarly elusive over the last 50 years but now exist in a cost effective/practical form? It’s okay if they’re obscure.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are some long foretold/delayed technologies that now exist?
GhOSt: Fast and Flexible User-Space Delegation of Linux Scheduling
Myanmar's pro-democracy forces resist with cryptocurrency
Feds' spending on facial recognition tech expands, despite privacy concerns
